benchmark_details.name: FINDVER (Explainable Claim Verification over Long and Hybrid-Content Financial Documents)
benchmark_details.overview: FINDVER is a comprehensive benchmark specifically designed to evaluate the explainable claim verification capabilities of LLMs in the context of understanding and analyzing long, hybrid-content financial documents. It contains 2,400 expert-annotated examples, divided into three subsets: information extraction, numerical reasoning, and knowledge-intensive reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating the capabilities of LLMs in claim verification over complex, expert-domain documents.

data.source: Quarterly (Form 10-Q) and annual reports (Form 10-K) from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparison of LLM performance against human expert performance.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in verifying claims based on financial documents.
methodology.validation: Data quality validation involves proofreading by models and validation by separate expert annotators.
